replies.body: erm... I might sound like a noob but does it really affect you with which type of mouse pad you use?

replies.body: Yes, it kind of does, but, it depends on the mouse.  For the death adder a sturdy yet soft, material does the trick :)  But generally it doesn't matter.

replies.body: Using a good mousepad isnt necessary, you can play fine without it, but a good mousepad is just as important as a good mouse, not necessary, but incredibly helpful and can massively improve performance. Also i just got the same mouse.Congrats. Also deathadder is longer lasting in general than naga and other razor product lines, and can hold out through a lot, but naga has more side buttons if you for some reason care
replies.body_tagged: Using a good mousepad isnt necessary, you can play fine without it, but a good mousepad is just as important as a good mouse, not necessary, but incredibly helpful and can massively improve performance. Also i just got the same mouse.Congrats. replies.body: Mouse pad makes no difference. From experience playing on a variety of surfaces frequently (Paper, wood, plastic, mattress, old desktop computer and carpet) It really does not make a difference.
replies.body_tagged: Mouse pad makes no difference. From experience playing on a variety of surfaces frequently (Paper, wood, plastic, mattress, old desktop computer and carpet) It really does not make a difference.
